Capability.CapabilityName: Wideband 2-MIC Headset Endfire Voice Assistant Wakeon
Wideband 2-MIC Headset Endfire Voice Assistant Bargein

PiecewiseBitField.Description: The Acoustic Echo Canceller is designed to reduce echo that is caused by the acoustic coupling of the loudspeaker to the microphone.
Residual Echo Cancellation is best used when there are no non-linearities in a system and the acoustic coupling of the system is minimal.
When Comfort Noise is enabled, it provides smoothness to the background noise during echo removal times and enhances perceptual quality of audio.

Provides attenuation to the send out signal when the echo signal at the microphone (acoustic coupling) is very loud and provides half duplex communication when the coupling crosses the Howling Suppression Coupling Threshold.
The Noise Suppression block is used to define the aggressiveness and quality of the noise suppression algorithm.
Wind Noise Reduction detects and reduces the wind noise in the presence of wind while attempting to improve speech quality.
The Automatic Gain Control (AGC) automatically adjusts the signal to a specific level determined by the AGC Target Level parameter.

The Noise Dependent Volume Control automatically increases or decreases the loudspeaker volume depending on the level of noise in the environment. This feature should be enabled in volume control capability as well to take effect.
Bypass the Microphone Calibration which compensates for microphone sensitivity/gain differences.
Spatial VAD in Noise PSD update
When not bypassed, the headset stores the MGDC information for future calls (after a power-up). Otherwise, it re-computes starting from zero.

AEC FNLMS filter upper frequency limit, above which echo cancellation is not processed. Note that the maximum frequency is depend on usecase, for example, for SWB 16000 Hz is the limit.
